Issues.Title: Improve DesignerCategoryAttribute class
Issues.Body:
If you have written a Control class, but you don't want to use **Visual Studio Form Designer** to design the control, you can use the following class.

**DesignerCategoryAttribute** class:
https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/dotnet/api/system.componentmodel.designercategoryattribute

Sample Code:
```
    [DesignerCategory("")]
    internal class NewControl : UserControl
    {
    }
```

Scene:

Suppose you are extending some Controls, Sometimes you don't need to change the UI for it, just adjust the default values of some properties and methods/functions of the original class. So you don't need to use the design interface because Visual Studio may create extra files (like NewControl.Designer.cs and NewControl.resx). And when you double-click the file item from panel, Visual Studio will automatically run the Form Designer (**This step often takes a few extra seconds**) and may create the extra files. Sometimes these steps are not necessary.

If you use the DesignerCategoryAttribute, Visual Studio will not create extra files, and you can quickly start writing your code without opening Form Designer.

But at present there is a problem with the DesignerCategory class. When you use it on a class, all the classes **derived** from it will no longer open the **Form Designer**.

Is there a flexible way that the user can autonomously control whether all inherited classes also need to be treated the same way?

eg:
```
    [DesignerCategory("", CurrentOnly = true)]
    internal class NewControl : UserControl
    {
    }
```

You can use the **CurrentOnly** property to decide that the DesignerCategory class is only valid for the current class.
This way it won't be passed into all derived classes.

Without this setting, when you have dozens of classes all derived from this class, you need to reset for each class, which is very time consuming.

Supplement:

Picture 1.
Suppose you just want to write a **pure** class, but when you double click the file item, Visual Studio will create other files.

![001](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/88176616/158021175-cd6a01f5-a5b4-4666-bab4-52cc716e0135.png)

Picture 2.
If you use DesignerCategory class, all other controls that inherit from this class will also not be able to use Form Designer.

![002](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/88176616/158021273-809b5878-07c6-41d5-ad06-9d46f97f22af.png)
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "Improve DesignerCategoryAttribute class" (#6834)

Issues.Title: Renaming objects inside user control broke windows forms project completely
Issues.Body:
Using Visual studio 2022 Version 17.2.0 Preview 1.0 and I have 3 user controls with each one having datagrid. I renamed each datagrid in those user controls and suddenly the user controls disappeared from the design view and only appear when you run the application. If I try to add any new user controls to anywhere on my project I now get the error I have pasted below and I'm also getting these build errors whenever I try to add this new control to the project. My guess is that renaming the datagrid items in the user control wasn't successful and the project is still referencing the old names. Just my best guess

Error when adding new test user control to project:
![photo_2022-03-10_10-02-33](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/3075685/157694176-826854ab-c42c-4e03-a0ff-340f1cccb085.jpg)

Build errors that only appear when adding a new user control to project:
![photo_2022-03-10_09-35-41](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/3075685/157693644-6ad9ad5c-7741-44bb-aa96-a7eded0952fd.jpg)

Design view showing the far left control missing (watchlist) and the two on the right missing (alpaca overview and alpaca orders)
![photo_2022-03-10_10-22-03](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/3075685/157693904-8b0c9c07-c269-40c5-894e-65361f35ebe5.jpg)
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "Renaming objects inside user control broke windows forms project completely" (#6828)

Issues.Body:
EnableDynamicLoading properly set right now in the Microsoft.NET.Sdk.targets

Issues.Title: Form designer keep loading when targeting to .NET 7.0
Issues.Body:
### Description

When creating a Winforms .Net core application and targeting to .NET 7.0, Form designer keep loading and an error dialog pops out, WSOD page is shown after few minutes.

### Reproduction Steps

1.	Create a Winforms .NET Core application
2.	Observe Form designer that opens automatically


### Expected behavior

Forms designer can displayed successfully.

### Actual behavior

Form designer keeps loading. WSOD page is shown after few minutes.
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/54019172/157617256-1eeb38a2-0b22-4b8e-9751-e557cfba1d4e.png)
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/54019172/157615899-c4753ed2-5ec9-4887-8c71-dae084af825c.png)


### Regression?

Yes, it's a regression issue and cannot repro in 7.0.100-preview.3.22153.22.

### Known Workarounds

_No response_

### Configuration
.Net 7.0.100-preview.3.22159.27

### Other information

This issue also occurs in WPF project.
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/54019172/157617922-4a331f7f-208c-4a8e-a509-0f5cbb8eddb8.png)
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "Form designer keep loading when targeting to .NET 7.0" (#6829)

Issues.Title: .NET 6 Winforms Designer / Argument Exception: Illegal characters in path
Issues.Body:
.NET 6
VS2022 17.2 Preview 1 (Same Problem with 17.1)

**Problem description:**
When I edit a .NET 6 WinForms project and want to open the Designer for a UserControl / Form there, the following exception appears

![2022_03_08_11_11_40_Window](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/55090340/157215631-11cb1027-79de-48aa-a99d-e7e37fd9bf34.png)

Output from Winforms Designer logging (Verbose)

[11:06:01.0283033] Creating VSCodeDomDesignerLoader
[11:06:01.0543468] Processed 'System.Design' in 00:00:00.0998389
[11:06:01.0638662] Added 'System.Design'
[11:06:01.0648675] Loaded System.Drawing.Design in 00:00:00.0000189 [thread 35]
[11:06:01.0648675] Processed 'System.Drawing.Design' in 00:00:00.0001717
[11:06:01.0648675] Added 'System.Drawing.Design'
[11:06:01.2783607] [Thread 1] Creating design-time ITypeResolutionService.
[11:06:01.3429998] Current VS Version = 17.0
[11:06:01.3439981] Start processing enqueued assemblies
[11:06:01.3449974] Loaded Microsoft.WinForms.DesignTools.Protocol in 00:00:00.0000081 [thread 31]
[11:06:01.3599982] Processed 'Microsoft.WinForms.DesignTools.Protocol' in 00:00:00.0149551
[11:06:01.3619986] Added 'Microsoft.WinForms.DesignTools.Protocol'
[11:06:01.3619986] Loaded Microsoft.WinForms.DesignTools.Client in 00:00:00.0000074 [thread 31]
[11:06:01.3849983] Processed 'Microsoft.WinForms.DesignTools.Client' in 00:00:00.0224528
[11:06:01.3859974] Added 'Microsoft.WinForms.DesignTools.Client'
[11:06:01.5205867] [Thread 68] Launching server...
[11:06:03.3003038] System.ArgumentException: Illegal characters in path.
                      at System.Security.Permissions.FileIOPermission.EmulateFileIOPermissionChecks(String fullPath)
                      at System.IO.Directory.InternalCreateDirectoryHelper(String path, Boolean checkHost)
                      at Microsoft.WinForms.Utilities.Shared.ShadowCacheFolder..ctor(Boolean isNetCoreProject)
                      at Microsoft.DotNet.DesignTools.Client.Host.ServerLayout.<CreateAsync>d__8.MoveNext()
                   --- End of stack trace from previous location where exception was thrown ---
                      at System.Runtime.ExceptionServices.ExceptionDispatchInfo.Throw()
                      at System.Runtime.CompilerServices.TaskAwaiter.HandleNonSuccessAndDebuggerNotification(Task task)
                      at Microsoft.DotNet.DesignTools.Client.Host.ServerProcess.<CreateAsync>d__21.MoveNext()
                   --- End of stack trace from previous location where exception was thrown ---
                      at System.Runtime.ExceptionServices.ExceptionDispatchInfo.Throw()
                      at System.Runtime.CompilerServices.TaskAwaiter.HandleNonSuccessAndDebuggerNotification(Task task)
                      at Microsoft.DotNet.DesignTools.Client.Host.ServerHostFactory.<CreateHostAsync>d__7.MoveNext()
                   --- End of stack trace from previous location where exception was thrown ---
                      at System.Runtime.ExceptionServices.ExceptionDispatchInfo.Throw()
                      at System.Runtime.CompilerServices.TaskAwaiter.HandleNonSuccessAndDebuggerNotification(Task task)
                      at Microsoft.DotNet.DesignTools.Client.DesignToolsClientLoader.<CreateClientAsync>d__28.MoveNext()
                   --- End of stack trace from previous location where exception was thrown ---
                      at System.Runtime.ExceptionServices.ExceptionDispatchInfo.Throw()
                      at Microsoft.VisualStudio.Telemetry.WindowsErrorReporting.WatsonReport.GetClrWatsonExceptionInfo(Exception exceptionObject)
[11:06:04.1210052] Cannot update selection in server process as Session is not connected.

I've tried it with several .NET 6 Projects, allways the same error.

**Expected behavior:**

Designer should open without any exception
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed issue ".NET 6 Winforms Designer / Argument Exception: Illegal characters in path" (#6810)

Issues.Title: The team have a extremely limited test capabilities in which COM is used
Issues.Body:
We (the team) have a extremely limited test capabilities and limited understanding of real scenarios in which COM is used in conjunction with Windows Forms apps. This makes it very difficult to accept changes in this area without good and verifiable test coverage.

_Originally posted by @RussKie in https://github.com/dotnet/winforms/issues/6743#issuecomment-1061349988_
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "The team have a extremely limited test capabilities in which COM is used" (#6808)
